problems.title: Nth Fibonacci Number under Modulo
problems.description:
The Fibonacci sequence is defined as: F0 = 0, F1 = 1, and Fn = F(n-1) + F(n-2) for n >= 2.
You are given two integers n and m. Your task is to compute Fn under modulo m.

Input Format:
Two space-separated integers n and m.

Output Format:
Print a single integer, Fn % m.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
10 1000

Sample Output
55

Explanation:
F10 = 55, and 55 % 1000 = 55.
hintsList: Use fast doubling or matrix exponentiation to compute Fibonacci in O(log n) time, taking modulo m at every addition/multiplication.
